body.p: Overview: For those organizations that sell a limited number of assignments (seats) for their organizational subscriptions (memberships), there is often a need to sell additional seats at a nominal price of the organizational subscription. This page reviews the process for creating a Sales Order that contains the correct Sales Order Lines with the appropriate Items.

User Story 1: The National Association of Partners (NAP) sells a Corporate membership that allows the assignment of 3 seats for $1,200. They also allow their members to purchase additional seats at $500 per person. The NAP has a partnership that wishes to purchase 4 assignments for membership. Follow the story below to meet this requirement.
A few months later, the NAP's customer wishes to add an additional seat to a subscription mid-term. They wish to purchase the Corporate Membership Additional Seat for $500.
The following items must be created prior to creating the Sales Order. Both these items should share the same Item Class.

ul.li: An Item, "Corporate Membership," that restricts the number of assignments to 3.

li.p: An Item, "Corporate Membership Additional Seat" that restricts the number of assignments to 1.

Because the organization does not allow the Corporate Membership Additional Seat item to be sold without a Corporate Membership, you should mark the Not Available for Individual Sale checkbox. This will not allow the item to be displayed in the shopping cart unless it is presented as a Packaged Item.

ul.li:
The Corporate Membership Additional Seat product should be a Package Item for the Corporate Membership.
Link the Additional Seat to the Corporate Membership by clicking the New Package Item button in the Package Item related list of the Corporate Membership Item.
Select the item to package, "Corporate Membership Additional Seat"
Be sure to add a Display Label, "Additional Seats," to easily identify there are additional seats available for purchase.
Enter an Add to Cart Button Label, "Add Seats".
Enter Display Instructions for your users to easily understand how to add the package item, Additional Seat.

p.b: Assign the Subscription Plan to your Items

body.p: Once your Items have been created and they are ready to be purchased, follow the steps below:

ul.li: Create a Sales Order for the customer and fill out all necessary fields.
Create a Sales Order Line for the Sales Order that includes the Corporate Membership with all relevant Subscription fields populated.

Add an Additional Sales Order Line for the Corporate Membership Additional Seat.
When creating the additional line, copy the Subscription Line Name of the Sales Order Line that has the Corporate Membership. You will need to define this Sales Order Line as the parent so that the subscription is populated correctly.
Create the second Sales Order Line.
Select the Corporate Membership Additional Seat as the Item.
Populate the Sales Order Line field with the Name of the Sales Order Line with the Corporate Membership.
Click Save.
Once the Sales Order has been completed, update the Status to "Closed," then update the Posting Status to "Posted."

body.p: Remember that marking the Sales Order as "Posted" is the action that triggers the creation of the Subscription and Subscription Lines.
Follow these steps to add your additional seats in the shopping cart

ul.li: Find the Corporate Membership and click Add to Cart.
Click the Additional Seats navigation button.
Select the number of Additional Seats to add to the order.

body.p: The image to the right shows the resulting Subscription that is created after posting the Sales Order. The following are areas you should look for when creating a Subscription that aggregates seats.

li.p: The total number of Assigned Seats equals the sum of Allowed Assignments for both Items.

ul.li: Notice also that the Primary Item is defined on the Subscription detail.
Two Subscription Lines representing the two products purchased.

p.b: Creating the Sales Order and Sales Order Lines

body.p: Once your Items have been created and they are ready to be purchased, follow the steps below:

ul.li: Create a Sales Order for the customer and fill out all necessary fields.

Create a Sales Order Line for the Sales Order.
Populate the Item with the "Corporate Membership Additional Seat."
Populate the Subscription (Upgrade/Renew) field with the Subscription to which the seat is to be added.
Click Save.
Once the Sales Order has been completed, update the Status to "Closed." Then update the Posting Status to "Posted."

body.p: Remember that marking the Sales Order as "Posted" is the action that triggers the creation of the Subscription, Subscription Lines, and Logs.
The image to the right shows the resulting Subscription that is created after posting the Sales Order. The following are areas you should look for when creating a Subscription that aggregates seats.

ul.li: The total number of Assigned Seats should show the total number of Assignments Allowed.
A new Subscription Line added to the Subscription.
